result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bruce Michael Valind not in court.  Attorney Carrie J LaPlant in court for Bruce Michael Valind.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Linssen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant moved to Stanley Correctional.  Present bond continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Dana J Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in court via phone, in custody at Dodge.  Attorney Carrie J LaPlant in court for Bruce Michael Valind.  Present bond continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

08:30 AM Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in court with attorney Carrie J LaPlant, both via zoom.  Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in custody at BCJ.  Asst. District Attorney John Luetscher appears in person on behalf of the State. Present bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in court via zoom with attorney Carrie J LaPlant, in person.  Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in custody at BCJ.  Asst. District Attorney Jonathan Gigot appears in person on behalf of the State. Not guilty pleas entered. Present bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in court with attorney Carrie J LaPlant.  Defendant Bruce Michael Valind in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record.
Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:45 am.
